section: Malhar - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਮਿਲਤ ਪਿਆਰੋ ਪ੍ਰਾਨ ਨਾਥੁ ਕਵਨ ਭਗਤਿ ਤੇ ॥
section: Malhar - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: What sort of devotional worship will lead me to meet my Beloved, the Lord of my breath of life?

transliteration.text: milat piārō prān nāth kavan bhagat tē .

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Malhar - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, I have obtained the supreme status. ||Pause||

translation.text: How long shall I wash these dirty clothes?

text: ਜੋਈ ਜੋਈ ਜੋਰਿਓ ਸੋਈ ਸੋਈ ਫਾਟਿਓ ॥
section: Malhar - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Whatever I was attached to, has perished.

transliteration.text: jōī jōī jōriō sōī sōī phātiō .

melody.description: Malhar is a communication of feelings from the soul, to show the mind how to become cool and refreshed. The mind is always burning with the desire to reach its goals quickly and without effort, however the emotions conveyed in this Raag are able to bring composure and fulfilment to the mind. It is able to bring the mind into this calmness, bringing a sense of satisfaction and contentment.

text: ਝੂਠੈ ਬਨਜਿ ਉਠਿ ਹੀ ਗਈ ਹਾਟਿਓ ॥੨॥
section: Malhar - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The shop of false merchandise has closed down. ||2||

transliteration.text: jhūthai banaj uth hī gaī hātiō .2.

text: ਜੋਈ ਜੋਈ ਕੀਨੋ ਸੋਈ ਸੋਈ ਦੇਖਿਓ ॥੩॥੧॥੩॥
section: Malhar - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: whatever the mortal has done, he shall see. ||3||1||3||

transliteration.text: jōī jōī kīnō sōī sōī dēkhiō .3.1.3.
